Key Match Events: Tyrese Haliburton scored 27 points and had eight assists without committing a turnover.
Myles Turner added 20 points, six rebounds, and three blocks.
Kevin Durant led the Suns with 25 points, seven rebounds, and seven assists.
Devin Booker had 20 points, nine rebounds, and nine assists.
Indiana broke a 56-all halftime tie with the first five points of the second half and had a pivotal 40-point third quarter.
Indiana capped its big third quarter with a late 12-5 run that extended an eight-point lead to 96-82.
Post-Match Reflections: Phoenix Suns coach Mike Budenholzer is still waiting for career win No. 500.
Indiana Pacers have won eight times in their last 11 games to reach .500.
Others: Indiana had 35 assists on 46 baskets and only six turnovers while outrebounding the Suns 47-37.
Phoenix makes the second stop on a three-game trip Monday at Philadelphia, while the Pacers travel to Brooklyn on Monday.
